pageContext.claim: “In 2015 and 2016, we witnessed the steepest two-year consecutive increase in murders in nearly half a century.”
pageContext.analysis: While the national murder rate climbed 20 percent from 2014 to 2016, the highest two-year increase since the 1960s, the rate is still much lower than in the 1990s.  Criminologists warn that crime data must be viewed over long periods of time, such as a decade, as one or two year changes may not be meaningful.
